doc: Story of a man who has unnatural feelings for a pig

Airport '77 starts as a brand new luxury 747 plane is loaded up with valuable paintings & such belonging to rich businessman Philip Stevens (James Stewart) who is flying them & a bunch of VIP's to his estate in preparation of it being opened to the public as a museum, also on board is Stevens daughter Julie (Kathleen Quinlan) & her son
This film lacked something I couldn't put my finger on at first: charisma on the part of the leading actress
Sorry everyone I know this is supposed to be an "art" film, but wow, they should have handed out guns at the screening so people could blow their brains out and not watch
When I was little my parents took me along to the theater to see Interiors
This movie gets better each time I see it (which is quite often)
My only complaint is that Brooks should have cast someone else in the lead (I love Mel as a Director and Writer, not so much as a lead)
Again, Warren was the best actor in the movie, but "Fume" and "Sailor" both played their parts well
This isn't the comedic Robin Williams, nor is it the quirky/insane Robin Williams of recent thriller fame
